channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 18 inch + large pothole., 9th February
item.description:
Very large pothole/crater. Unable to avoid and particularly dangerous for motorcycles and cars in the dark/wet! It has been there for a long time and nothing done! It will cause a tyre to blow out soon or possibly a motorcyclist to have an accident! Please fix it ASAP and stop saying there is no defect! It is massive!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The majority of the drains on Battldown Approach are blocked, 9th February
item.description:
The majority of the drains on Battledown Approach are blocked by leaves, twigs etc that have fallen from the trees. As a result during recent heavy rain a river of water was running down the road onto Hales Road where it formed a sizeable lake that traffic couldn't avoid.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding covering one lane of a two lane section, 9th February
item.description:
Kerb Drain blocked causing flooding ///fully.lasted.rust

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telstar Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain/collapsed underground pipe, 9th February
item.description:
Yet again, the drain at the junction of Green Lane and Cirencester Road opposite my house in Little Witcombe is blocked. Excess water is running across the road and the first signs of it are appearing in my cellar. Can you please dispatch a crew to clear the drain as soon as possible. There must be a long term solution to this problem, which has been recurring for years. Members of the last crew that attended the site in January confirmed there is a collapsed drainage pipe. Given that the cause is known, why can't the problem be rectified?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain flooding road, 9th February
item.description:
Blocked drain outside 72 Whaddon Road is flooded. Floods often, needs repair.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 9th February
item.description:
Pothole has been patched several times but keeps coming back. Always floods when it rains, and large traffic causes homes to shake. Holes are large enough to cause damage to vehicle suspension and causes cars to swerve.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approx 50 potholes in Caernarvon Road which are now very deep with loose stones being clipped by psssinh vehicles on, 9th February
item.description:
Many, many potholes now from Warden Hill Road to the end of Caernarvon Road of which are very deep and round, with loose stones being clipped by vehicles going through them and going onto pavements and possibly a passing cyclist! This has been reported many times! I understand the road is only being resurfaced up to Alma Road which is not far enough. I have just walked the length of it and lost count of them!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Divider kerb between road and turning area has come loose and lifted up causing damage to cars and a trip hazard., 9th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Springfield Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Flooding across doorway, 9th February
item.description:
Flooding across doorway of Food Pantry. Iâ€™m told that Highways dealt with this previously and as this is potentially affecting food pick ups and drop offs, it will be very much appreciated if this could be attended promptly.

item.title: Broken, uneven, pot holed road, 9th February
item.description:
Withybridge Lane - road surface is in an appalling state. It forces drivers to take avoiding action. The whole stretch of road needs re-surfacing. The tarmac repairs that are carried out occasionally barely last a winter. SORT IT OUT ONCE and FOR ALL!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withybridge Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on A46 , Farm Lane to No 3., 9th February
item.description:
Flooding on the A46 Shurdindgton Road. Creating ri ers of water on both sides of the road. Vehicles are driving through the water creating waves covering the paths! Drainage is not coping with the rain water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
